snippet: A judge in Maine rejected arguments that a nurse who treated Ebola patients in West Africa should have her movements restricted, despite the public’s fears about the virus.
abstract: Maine Judge Charles C LaVerdiere rejects arguments that Kaci Hickox, nurse who treated Ebola patients in West Africa, should be highly restricted in her movements, noting that Hickox has not displayed symptoms of disease; order appears likely to end standoff between Hickox and state of Maine and to influence future court decisions regarding health care workers returning from West Africa.

byline.original: By JESS BIDGOOD and DAVE PHILIPPS
byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood reported from Fort Kent, and Dave Philipps from New York. Kate Zernike contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: A judge in Maine rejected arguments that a nurse who treated Ebola patients in West Africa should have her movements restricted, despite the public’s fears about the virus.

headline.main: Judge in Maine Eases Restrictions on Nurse
headline.print_headline: Judge in Maine Eases Restrictions on Nurse

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
